description: the mail address of the current account.

the text added by the user before sending the prompt. To use this placeholder the "Ask for additional text" flag must be set in the prompt configuration. You can define more instances of this placeholder, defining different <Placeholder-ID>, that will be shown in the form used to ask the value to the user. This placeholder is not available in the "Add tags" and "Add Calendar Event" special prompts.
the author of the email.
the list of addresses of the CC field of the email, separated by a comma.
the current date and time.
the Junk score of the email, only for received emails.
prints a list of information about the attachments of the email, in the form "file name" [file type] (file size). As an example: "google.png" [image/png] (2 KB).
the date and time of the email.
the folder name containing the email.
the complete path of the folder containing the email.
the body of the email in HTML.
a selection if there is any, otherwise the body of the email in HTML.
this placeholders autoselects the quoted text only when is after the reply text, removing any previous manual made selection.
the subject of the email.
the body of the email in plain text.
a selection if there is any, otherwise the body of the email in plain text.
this placeholders autoselects the text typed in a message only when it's before the quoted email, removing any previous manual made selection.
the list of recipients of the email, separated by a comma.
the text selected by the user. To use this placeholder the "Text selection needed" flag must be set in the prompt configuration.
the html part of the text selected by the user. To use this placeholder the "Text selection needed" flag must be set in the prompt configuration.
a comma separated list of the tags of the current email.
a comma separated list of all the tags available in Thunderbird.
the default signature as defined in the ThunderAI options page.
the default language as defined in the ThunderAI options page.

use this placeholder to get the value of any mail header, replacing <Header-ID> with the ID of the header you wish to retrieve. For example, use {%mail_headers:Received-SPF%} to use the value of Received-SPF.

this placeholder will be replaced by an empty string. This allows you to use a prompt that doesn't include any information from the email and prevents the email body from being automatically appended at the end.
